title: 108_s2909
content: The Act is titled the "Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area Natural Gas Pipeline Enlargement Act" and includes definitions for various terms used in the legislation. SEC. 2. DEFINITIONS. The Act defines terms such as Corporation, Pipeline, Recreation Area, Secretary, and Superintendent. The Secretary may grant an easement to the Corporation to enlarge the pipeline diameter from 14 to 20 inches in the Recreation Area, with conditions to protect resources and minimize disturbance during construction. The Secretary may grant an easement to the Corporation for enlarging the pipeline diameter in the Recreation Area, subject to conditions to protect resources. The Superintendent can issue a permit for temporary construction and staging areas, with requirements to consult and identify potential damage to natural and cultural resources. The Secretary may grant an easement to the Corporation for enlarging the pipeline in the Recreation Area, with conditions to protect resources. The Corporation must submit a restoration and mitigation plan to the Superintendent for approval, outlining maintenance of the easement land and specific activities to mitigate damages or restore natural and cultural resources. The pipeline enlargement will meet replacement requirements as mandated by the Research. The Corporation must comply with FERC certification requirements for pipeline size increase. No further pipeline diameter or easement increases allowed within the Recreation Area. The Act does not expand the 50-foot right-of-way easement. Penalties may be imposed for non-compliance with restoration and mitigation plans. The Corporation may face penalties under Public Law 101-337 if it violates easement provisions or fails to implement restoration plans, resulting in harm to park resources.
